definition: to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: "There were vases being broken and people climbing over other people and a lot of screaming," Bieber fan Taylor Inder told the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 到处都有花瓶被砸碎，人们相互拥挤着并大声尖叫。

sentences.english: It was you who crushed the heads of Leviathan and gave him as food to the creatures of the desert.
sentences.chinese: 你曾砸碎鳄鱼的头，把他给旷野的禽兽为食物。
噢，不会吧，他将镜子砸碎了。

sentences.english: Chains shall He break, for the slave is our brother.
sentences.chinese: 衪将砸碎锁链，因是我们的兄弟受捆绑。

sentences.english: A cafe on Deansgate also had its windows smashed.
sentences.chinese: Deansgate的一家咖啡馆的窗户也被砸碎。

sentences.english: He smashed the headlights and taillights.
sentences.chinese: 他又砸碎了甲壳虫的前灯和尾灯。

sentences.english: He steps out of his dugout, grabs his sniper rifle and smashes it to the tree.
sentences.chinese: 于是他拿着他的狙击枪爬出掩体，朝树上狠狠砸碎。

sentences.english: Dhains shall He break, for the slave is our brother.
sentences.chinese: 衪将砸碎锁链儿，因是咱们的兄弟受绑缚。

sentences.english: Palmer turns his rage instead to a vase sending it shattering.
sentences.chinese: 帕默将他的怒火发泄到一只花瓶上，将它砸碎。

sentences.english: He landed in the back seat of a car after crashing through the windscreen.
sentences.chinese: 他掉在了一辆车上，砸碎了风挡，落在后座区域。
他们把那只箱子砸碎了。

sentences.english: He left leg was smashed below the knee.
sentences.chinese: 他的左腿膝盖以下部分也已经被砸碎了。

sentences.english: However, both full and empty bottles are theoretically capable of fracturing the human neurocranium.
sentences.chinese: 不过理论上两者都能砸碎人类脑颅。

definition: to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to cleave/to split open/to spread open (fingers, legs)
